oai_dc:dc.dc:title: USING THE RASINTERFOAM CFD MODEL FOR WAVE TRANSFORMATION AND COASTAL MODELLING
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Morgan, Gerald Charles John
Zang, Jun
Greaves, Deborah
Heath, Andrew
Whitlow, Chris
Young, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: CFD
OpenFOAM
Wave Propagation
rasInterFoam
Coastal Modeling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The CFD model, rasInterFoam, part of the OpenFOAM library for continuum mechanics, is used to reproduce experimental results for the propagation of monochromatic waves over a submerged bar. The model is shown to reproduce the experimental results very well on the front face and top of the bar, and give adequate results on the back face, even on extremely coarse meshes. Sensitivity analyses are presented for the model results, investigating the dependence on mesh density and discretisation scheme of the model. The modeling of the wave transformations in the model is shown to be broadly insensitive to these parameters within the ranges tested.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 32 (2010): Proceedings of 32nd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Shanghai, China, 2010.; waves.23
